alert.note: Alert for Fresno; Madera; Tulare (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 09 at 4:32PM PST until further notice by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following counties, Fresno, Madera and Tulare. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 431 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fresno, Clovis, Sanger, Reedley, Selma, Dinuba, Orosi, Parlier, Kingsburg, Orange Cove, Del Rey, Calwa, Bowles, Easton, London, Fowler, Fancher Creek, Hurley, Trimmer Springs and Friant. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are many low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
